attributes.action: If a child tests positive for covid19 they should self isolate at their home
attributes.additional_details: To allow children to self isolate at their own homes where possible, if this is not possible they should then self isolate to a place of their parents/guardians choice. Under no circumstances should any child be taken to a government facility to isolate against their parents/guardians choice
attributes.background: If a child tests positive for covid19 they should then self isolate at home with their family, or a place of their legal guardians choice and not under any circumstances be taken to a government facility!!

rejection.details:
Children are not being detained in Government facilities and there are no plans to detain children against parents' wishes. In most cases, medical treatment and testing already needs parental consent. We therefore don't know what you want to happen. 

You can find out more about what the Coronavirus Act and children here: 
https://fullfact.org/online/children-coronavirus-act/

You can find out how to spot false information online here: https://sharechecklist.gov.uk/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
